page.title: 18FELBRIGG CHURCH
page.content: The church is situated 500 metres from the Hall, and almost 1 kilometre from the village. It stands on its own, surrounded by fields and pasture. War-time ploughing revealed evidence of a settlement around the church. It seems that the village was re-sited so as not to spoil the view from the Hall when it was built. The church was largely re-built in the 15th century, and is noted for some very fine{brasses. }The earliest brass is dated 1351 A.D., and depicts {Simon de Felbrigg,}his wife Alice and Roger de Felbrigg and his wife. The best brass is that of{Sir Simon {Felbrigg}in full armour, and Lady Felbrigg, dated 1416 A.D. There are also memorials to other members of the {Felbrigg}and{Windham}families. The brasses are an added attraction for visitors to Felbrigg Hall.
